author: chris2_2_2
content:
I replied to Tim's post on twitter about the best investment and mentioned childhood education. That actually brings up a topic I'm passionate about, testnets. I mean, kids could learn off of a L2 or ETHW but what would really be best is to have an ETH testnet that mirrors mainnet that allows people learning eth to interact with the network and test contracts. I think there would be a lot of value in encouraging dapps and others like uniswap, 1inch, etc. to maintaining a mirror/reflection on a testnet that new users to ETH could experiment with.

I don't know about others cities, but here childhood education in programming/mechanics is taking off and the next logical step is getting them into crypto. I think eth-focused education materials oriented towards beginners/children are lacking.
